location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Nicholas Hankey Smith, Resident at Bushire to Jonathan Duncan, President and Governor in Council, Bombay

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The item has suffered from pest damage, which has resulted in a large hole in the fabric of the item. As a result, some of the text within the body of the letter has been obscured and is difficult to read. Parts of the signature and the address of the letter have also been slightly obscured, but it is still possible to make these out.

mods.abstract: The letter concerns command of the cruizers of the East India Company in the Gulf. It includes a request that the Government of Bombay revise current practice and make the commanders of such vessels subject to the orders of the Resident upon their arrival at Bushire.
